title: Framingham Heart Failure Diagnostic Criteria
description: Diagnoses heart failure based on major and minor criteria. Requires at least 2 major criteria or 1 major criterion plus 2 minor criteria.

parameters.name: neck_vein_distention
parameters.description: Neck vein distention (jugular venous distention) (major criterion)

parameters.name: paroxysmal_nocturnal_dyspnea_orthopnea
parameters.description: Paroxysmal nocturnal dyspnea or orthopnea (major criterion)

parameters.name: third_heart_sound
parameters.description: Third heart sound (S3 gallop rhythm) (major criterion)

parameters.name: tachycardia
parameters.description: Tachycardia (heart rate >120 beats per minute) (minor criterion)

result.name: heart_failure_diagnosis
result.description: Heart failure diagnosis based on Framingham criteria

ranges.description: Criteria not met for heart failure diagnosis
ranges.interpretation: Framingham criteria not met for heart failure diagnosis. Fewer than 2 major criteria or fewer than 1 major plus 2 minor criteria present. Consider alternative diagnoses and further evaluation if clinical suspicion remains high.

ranges.description: Criteria met for heart failure diagnosis
ranges.interpretation: Framingham criteria met for heart failure diagnosis. At least 2 major criteria or 1 major criterion plus 2 minor criteria present. Initiate appropriate heart failure evaluation and management according to current guidelines.

references: McKee PA, Castelli WP, McNamara PM, Kannel WB. The natural history of congestive heart failure: the Framingham study. N Engl J Med. 1971;285(26):1441-6.
Carlson KJ, Lee DC, Goroll AH, Leahy M, Johnson RA. An analysis of physicians' reasons for prescribing long-term digitalis therapy in outpatients. J Chronic Dis. 1985;38(9):733-9.

Marantz PR, Tobin JN, Wassertheil-Smoller S, et al. The relationship between left ventricular systolic function and congestive heart failure diagnosed by clinical criteria. Circulation. 1988;77(3):607-12.
Remes J, Miettinen H, Reunanen A, Pyörälä K. Validity of clinical diagnosis of heart failure in primary health care. Eur Heart J. 1991;12(3):315-21.
formula: Diagnosis requires: ≥2 major criteria OR 1 major criterion + ≥2 minor criteria. Minor criteria must not be attributable to other medical conditions.
notes: Developed in 1971 from the Framingham Heart Study data
97% sensitive and 79% specific for definite congestive heart failure diagnosis
100% sensitive and 78% specific in validation studies
Higher sensitivity for systolic heart failure (97%) vs diastolic heart failure (89%)
Negative likelihood ratio of 0.04 effectively rules out heart failure when criteria not met
Minor criteria acceptable only if not attributable to other conditions
Other conditions to exclude: pulmonary hypertension, chronic lung disease, cirrhosis, ascites, nephrotic syndrome
Widely used in clinical practice and research for heart failure diagnosis
Should be used in conjunction with modern diagnostic tools (echocardiography, BNP/NT-proBNP)
Particularly useful in resource-limited settings where advanced diagnostics may not be available
High sensitivity makes it excellent for ruling out heart failure
Clinical examination skills are essential for accurate assessment
Consider contemporary heart failure guidelines for comprehensive management
